```{r}
mydata <- read.csv(file="/home/nico/Documents/uba/2020/tdd/final/data/df1.csv", header=TRUE, sep=",") 

df = data.frame(
  "time" = mydata[[1]], 
  "handpos1" = mydata[[2]], 
  "handpos2" = mydata[[3]], 
  "cursorpos1" = mydata[[4]], 
  "cursorpos2" = mydata[[5]]
)

plot(df$time[df$time<19], df$handpos1[df$time<19], col="red", type = 'l',main = "HandPos x", xlab = "Time")


ts = df$time[df$time<19]
tss = seq(-6,20, length.out = 100)
obs = df$handpos1[df$time<19]
N = length(obs)

# Parametros dynamics
A  = 0.09

# Process noise
Q = 0.001

# Observation noise
R = 0.001

# Estado inicial
us = c(NA,N)
sigmas = c(NA,N)
us[1] = 0
sigmas[1] = sqrt(R)
kalman_gain = c(NA,N-1)

for(i in 2:N)
{

  # Plot prior
  #plot(tss, dnorm(tss,us[i-1], sigmas[i-1]), col = "red", type = 'l', main = paste("t = ", i), xlab = "Time", ylim = c(0,0.6))
  #      legend("topleft", legend = c("Prior", "Likelihood", "Post Dynamics", "Posterior"), 
  #       col = c("red", "blue", "red", "purple"), lty = c('solid', 'solid', 'dashed', 'solid') , cex = 0.8)
  
  # Predict (convolucion)
  sigma_dynamic = sqrt(Q**2 + A**2 * sigmas[i-1]**2)
  u_dynamic = A*us[i-1] 
  
  # Plot dynamics y likelihood
  lines(tss, dnorm(tss,obs[i],R) , col = "blue", lty = "solid")
  lines(tss, dnorm(tss,u_dynamic, sigma_dynamic), col = "red",  lty = "dashed")
  
  # Update
  W = sigma_dynamic**2 / (R**2 + sigma_dynamic**2)
  kalman_gain[i-1] = W
  
  us[i] =(u_dynamic)*(1-W) + W*obs[i]
  
  sigmas[i] = 1 / sqrt(( (1/(R**2)) + (1/(sigma_dynamic**2))  ) )
  
  # Plot posterior
  lines(tss, dnorm(tss,us[i], sigmas[i]), col = "purple",  lty = "solid")
  
}

print(us)
print(sigmas)
plot(ts, us, col = "red", type='l')
lines(ts, obs, col = "green", type = 'b')


plot(ts[2:N],kalman_gain, type='l')
```
